title: How I Search for Profitable KDP Niches in 2026

tactics.name: reverse_engineering_niche_selection
tactics.description: Prioritize back-end profitability by calculating net royalty after ad costs
steps: Calculate total royalty using KDP print cost calculator
Estimate ad cost per click ($1-$150+ depending on niche)
Compare net royalty (royalty - ad cost) to determine viability
caveats: Fails when ad costs exceed royalty margins
source_quotes: your total royalty minus your ad expense. The net royalty is going to be your take-home profit

tactics.name: Price and Review Filter
tactics.description: Filter books by price range and review count to identify profitable niches
steps: Use Book Beam niche finder for automated filtering
caveats: May miss niche opportunities with higher review counts
source_quotes: Anything below that, it don't make any sense to me

tactics.name: profitability_check
tactics.description: Calculate book profitability by comparing royalty rates to ad costs per click
steps: Calculate ad cost per click (CPC) and royalty rates
Determine number of clicks needed to break even
Assess if royalty rate provides sufficient margin
caveats: Low royalty rates (<$8) create risk if conversion rates are poor
source_quotes: $120 per click, you've only got about six to seven clicks until you start losing money

tactics.name: review_verification
tactics.description: Validate niche viability by analyzing Amazon review data
steps: Check Amazon review counts for competitive books
Assess difficulty of achieving similar review volume
caveats: High review counts may indicate saturated markets
source_quotes: Can you actually beat this many reviews?

heuristics.name: low_review_niche_boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with high content value
source_quotes: low content books... the math just doesn't make any sense

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with low competition
source_quotes: 0 to 200 reviews... very easy to make

heuristics.name: review_based_boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, boost niche viability
source_quotes: Focus on one or two books that you can be super super profitable

claims.statement: Total royalty is calculated as retail price minus print cost
source_quotes: your total royalty... price your retail price of the book minus print cost

claims.statement: Low content books have lower profitability due to limited royalty potential
source_quotes: Low content books... just doesn't make any sense

claims.statement: Low content books with $4 royalty and $1 CPC are unprofitable
source_quotes: I don't do low content books because obviously the $4 royalty, $1 CPC, it just simply for me maths don't work

niche_patterns.description: Target specific identity groups with unique problems and constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates niche demand with low competition
